result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice E. Granville

records.addlTxt:
2:04 PM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Maurice E. Granville in court.  Attorney Christopher William Rose in court for Maurice E. Granville. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CM730/22CM1375. Attorney Rose advises the Court that he still needs some discovery and is requesting an adjournment so he may discuss a global offer with the State. The State does not object. Court adjourns.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:37 AM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.   No appearance by the Defendant. Attorney Christopher William Rose appeared on behalf of the defendant.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Rose does not have an explanation as to why the DE is not here and advises the Court that he has not had any contact with the DE. Based on the DE's non-appearance the Court forfeits bond and issues a bench warrant with $500.00 cash bond.

Case recalled at 9:50 AM.  Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Maurice E. Granville, appeared with Attorney Christopher William Rose.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: DE appears late and advises the Court that he woke up late. Discussion held. Court vacates the warrant previously issued and reinstates bond. Attorney Rose is requesting an adjournment as he needs to meet with the DE and review discovery. The State does not object. Court adjourns.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Officer McDonough

02:21 PM   Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State under supervision of Attorney Brost.   Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Benjamin Schwarz. Clerk PU.  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 02:10 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 09:30 am. $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event). rb
and witness list filed by the State
